Hornet-class battlepods were designed by Earth Industries during the Syrtis war, in preparation for the Commonwealth's attack on Mars.
However, the Hornet was deemed insufficiently surviveable by the Commonwealth Fleet and a different plan was adopted involving nuclear bombardment.
EI had since sold the ship to the public, which attracted a cult following in hobbyist circles for its extreme speed. The design is so simple that many modern Hornets are DIY replicas, and the anarchists even have a version that can operate uncrewed, like a primitive auton.
The Hornet-class battlepod prioritizes speed above all else. It is not a ship for the faint of heart, but it does have its fans.

The Antares I was one of the first ships built at Makayev-Energia's Polyarny Shipyards in 2269 following the end of the Syrtis War.
Although the Antares I has since been surpassed in raw capabilities by both its own successors and competitors, the Antares I endures to this day as a cheap and simple to operate heavy freighter in low threat regions of space.
The Antares I is an entry-level heavy freighter with few capabilities beyond carrying a lot of bulk cargo on a budget.

Borer-class miners are a common sight across the New Beyond and Near Stars. Although they are slow and limited in flight capabilities, the Borer-class has established a reputation as a rugged and affordable design, easily able to make returns far greater than their purchase price.
The original UAS Borer-class predates the Syrtis war, and was instrumental in prospecting for the resources used to build the Earth Command fleet. Since then the UAS has also released improved designs like the Borer II and Borer III, fit for more dangerous regions such as the Ungoverned Territories.

When the EI100 was first introduced in the late 2100s, it was a fast and affordable transport able to quickly make interplanetary trips between stations, ferrying passengers and cargo alike.
Today it still sees regular use as a budget freighter completing low-volume last-leg deliveries.

Zubrin's Sapphire-class is a small and sporty ship, often being compared to planet-bound vintage sports cars. The compact interior comes with a selection of luxury finishes and options, though the small cabin means that most customers use the Sapphire for short in-system trips, rather than as a true yacht as Zubrin likes to imply with their marketing.

In the decades following the Syrtis war, various threats such as pirates and commerce raiders of various factions were threatening the commerce and logistics of the commonwealth's vast network of colonies.
Ships such as the Antares I were proven too vulnerable in many star systems, and the commonwealth had expanded too fast and too far to protect every freighter and trade lane.
Using improved technologies, Makayev-Energia provided an answer in the form of the Antares II, sporting improved armor and an additional turreted weapon slot.
Antares II-class heavy freighters are much better defended from attackers than the Antares I with their additional weapons and support for heavier armor.

When the EI200 was introduced in 2205, coming out of Earth Industries' then-new Theia Shipyards in Othrys, it was heralded as a revolutionary new freighter that improved on the EI100-class in just about every way. As designed, it became the de facto standard for shipping valuable goods and transporting VIPs.
These days, the EI200 is still a frequent sight in the Commonwealth, transporting cargo that needs protection from opportunistic pirates and raiders.

For budding DIY shipbuilding enthusiasts, the Meteor is usually one of the first stops along their journey. The components of the Meteor have been specifically optimized over the years by the opensource shipbuilding community to be printable in readily available household autofacs, rather than needing something a bit bigger, like a machine shop's autofac, which is a common problem for those who try to start with a Revolution Designs ship like an Earthzone.

The T31 Transport was released by the UAS as an affordable domestic alternative to the EI-series freighters, though it has also been a reasonably popular export to the Commonwealth as well.
As part of their proxy conflict with the Corporate Hierarchy, the UAS also provides these ships at a discount to Syndikat, who resells them on to smugglers and outlaws.
The T31 Transport is a light freighter with decent speed for a ship with its cargo capacity, though it has limited room for expansion.

The Asterion is well receieved among militias and mercenaries alike for its durable design and reasonable speed. NAMI offers the ship in a variety of configurations ranging from designs meant for local security near Saint Katherine's Star to variants equipped for the militia to fight off Sung raiders.

After the Syrtis war, the UAS developed this upgraded version of their venerable Borer class ships to enable prospecting for valuable materials in more dangerous regions of space as part of their effort to rebuild.
The ship became broadly popular among Commonwealth mining operations in the Ungoverned Territories for its continued focus on being a rugged no-frills design.

EI developed the EI500 as the new entry level freighter in the EI-series, releasing it in 2376 to replace the EI300 as their flagship light freighter. Unlike their previous light freighter, the EI500 offers significant improvements to speed and device power, borrowing the dual engine and engineering layout of its larger predecessors.
While not as revolutionary as the EI100 was for in-system shipping, the EI500 was still such a big leap forwards in capabilities that it resonated more strongly with intermediate range couriers than it did with the owners of the ships it was meant to replace. As a result Earth Industries still sells new-production EI300s alongside the EI500.

The Antares V was originally introduced in 2343 as a logistics transport for the Commonwealth Fleet. When released to the wider market, it saw much greater success than Makayev-Energia's previous attempts at stretching the Antares series, as it was much more capable of independent operation.
To save on development time, its hull was based on the Antares III - itself little more than a stretched Antares I - but incorporated the improved armor and weapon mounts of the Antares II at the behest of the Commonwealth Fleet.
The Antares V superfreighter strikes a balance between supporting tough armor and enough weaponry to deter attackers.

The T55 Transport is a UAS competitor to ships like the EI200.
As part of their proxy conflict with the Corporate Hierarchy, the UAS also provides these ships at a discount to Syndikat, who resells them on to smugglers and outlaws.
The T55 Transport is a larger and more capable sibling to the T31, with significantly better options for expansion

The Wolfen series was originally designed by Pacific Defense to act as fighters for the Commonwealth's aging but still nimble fleet carriers. However, with the Fleet's 2350s shift towards bulk and slow fortress-style carriers rather than agile fleet carriers, they began to prefer heavier designs like the Centurion as their gunships of choice.
The Wolfen/C is a civilian variant that was designed for local commonwealth militia and corporate security defense, where its limited range is no hinderance, and its ability to mount powerful weapons is a powerful deterrant. Occasionally these ships get upgraded by private owners for much greater range than they were designed for, often at a significant price.

EI introduced the EI7000 in 2389 to compliment the EI500's generation of EI-series freighters with a powerful and well-defended heavy freighter for transporting high value cargo. Since then, the EI7000 has become a favorite for Corporate Hierarchy factories, picking up shipments of finished goods like ship components and delivering them to drydocks and retailers.
An EI7000 is tough enough that it dissuades most pirates and raiders in the New Beyond on-sight unless they have access to capital ships, such as Drakes.

The Archer-class came about as a result of commonwealth citizens combining opensource component designs from Revolution Designs and Frontier Industrial. With the design being completely open, various small businesses have taken to selling Archer kits with components varying from new parts made in a home autofac, to cheap sets of intact salvage from other ships that share those common components.
Since neither Revolution Designs nor Frontier Industrial produce weapons, the devices for the ship kits are usually absent or just any off-the-shelf selection that is locally available.

The Armstrong-class transport is NAMI's dedicated freighter entry within their "Spage-age" ship series. NAMI opted to diversify their offerings by mixing in a variety of ship classes and roles under the same branding group to avoid a repeat of the marketing fiasco that the "Metropolis" series encountered, where a single unfavorable comparison of a gunship-only series to a competitor's gunship ruined the mindshare for all of the ships.
The Armstrong-class has made a name for itself as a resiliant and fast multipurpose transport good for carrying both cargo and passengers.

To meet growing demand for mining equipment that can tackle hard to mine materials in and around the Outer Realm, the UAS introduced the Borer III-class miner in 2332.
Even despite the conflicts that flared up in the region just one decade later, sales of the Borer III remained strong as individual Commonwealth and UAS citizens rushed out to try and get some of the valuable ores in the area.

The Elixer is Zubrin's top of the line offering in both luxury and spacious onboard accomodations. Unlike the Sapphire, the Elixer is designed with extended onboard living as its top priority. The Elixer is not without its detractors however, for as much as the internal opulence has received praise, the view from within the ship has also been criticized due to the large decorative shades obstructing many of the viewports. This even impacts the bridge, which relies on holographic displays to allow the crew to see around the shades.

The Scarab-class of multipurpose superfreighters were designed by NAMI in 2332 as no-frills haulers with swappable modules for carrying either fluid cargo or bulk ore.
Initially the Scarab was almost exclusively used by companies in the fuel mining industry. However, in 2372 the Commonwealth Fleet has started using them in addition to their Antares V superfreighters for logistics purposes - in this case for delivering large quantities of fuel for the massive Commonwealth Star Carriers and all of the gunships they support.

Unlike most improvised ship designs, the Buffalo pattern has its roots in an official NAMI design. During the early 2100s era colonization wave, NAMI introduced humanity's first fusion-powered ship, the colony ship CS Savannah.
The Savannah-class was designed to carry colonists and their supplies out to remote areas, where they could then disassemble the colony ship into a full colony station, as well as several smaller utility ships. By the 2170s to keep the Savannah-class dominant in the market, NAMI released the designs of many of the components to the public so that outlying colonies could manufacture replacement parts. Over time the opensource component community has evolved the original Buffalo design into a capable heavy gunship.

The Manticore class was originally in development for the Commonwealth Fleet in the 2360s as a new heavy gunship, but when the Ares began fielding Commetfalls in 2372 and brought the Commonwealth offensive to a halt, the Commonwealth was suddenly much more hesitant about adopting a ship meant for brute-force combat without as much concern for survivability.
Trials eventually confirmed their fears that the design of the Manticore which eschewed a traditional shield in favor of specialized armor repair systems in its as-designed configuration suddenly become very vulnerable the moment that it was faced with enough damage to overwhelm the armor repair device. After accepting a few dozen for testing purposes, the Fleet terminated the contact.
Makayev kept the name given to class ship by the Fleet and turned to the Commonwealth Militias and Corporate security forces for sales instead.
